content.description: Follow the line starting just right of the tree.  Not too interesting, but not too bad.  The main crux is in reading the rock.
content.protection: bolts, two good bolts at the top now.
content.location: Second from the left, just right / behind the bigleaf maple.

content.description: Tricky route starts just below the overhang and heads directly up the line of bolts in the middle of the rock.  The crux is in pulling over the second roof.  Helps to be tall.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 3 bolt anchor (2 together over the lip and 1 back another foot or so)
content.location: Start on the obvious feet below the low roof just left of all the graffiti.  Try and go straight up as much as possible and avoid traversing left into the tree route.

content.description: Completely overgrown, mossy route on the right side of the main face.  I read somewhere that the crack can be used for aid practice.  Probably not worth cleaning, but included her for completeness.
content.protection: A couple bolts, but again extremely mossy so they are possibly suspect.
content.location: Right most route, follow obvious bolts. through mossy overgrowth.

content.description:
Limestone! Not gonna find to much of this out here. Only one problem on this, if you climb moderate its worth it. Gym like start

Start low in the overhanging section
content.location: This is located across the street from the steven creek boulder, about 1000ft towards the mtns (west). You could walk up there (5 min) or drive (1 min) and stop in a pullout with a telephone pole i believe. Can fix a line or walk down a hill, and up the creek a few min, and you will see on the right bank.

content.description: Blocky and pretty dirty, probably not worth your time unless you have a true beginner along.
content.protection: 3 bolts and I think 1 at the top, though you should check the top of the rock to verify current conditions before leading.
content.location: On the left arete when looking at the main face. Around left of the bigleaf maple.

content.description: Start of the route is overhung. Sit start with left hand on small crimp on the face and right hand on a pinch to the right. First few moves are nice, finish the the problem on an obvious ledge, or continue climbing (V0) another 10 feet to the top and walk off back side of boulder.
content.location: On the far right side of the boulder (closest to the parking area)
